page.title: 13LANDSCAPE BEULAH - GARTH
page.content: Beulah - old houses, mostly rendered stone, some red brick. Few houses slated for weather protection. 9 new bungalows of modern materials, with tile roofs. Beulah Chapel, after which the village was named, set in an elevated position built 1821, enlarged 1883, has gallery on three sides, seats 300. Garth - much brick in old houses owing to one time brickworks on site of agricultural supplier. Village Hall, once a Mission Church, retains church- like windows and bell. The old school, now being converted into a house. Old station buildings have been completely demolished. Garth House, a small stone mansion of historical significance, is elevated near the village. Llanlleonfel Church is a small stone building, with belfry, on ancient site,restored 1873, seats 60.
